item.title: About
item.description: I’m Derek Lim, a first-year EECS PhD student at MIT CSAIL advised by Stefanie Jegelka. I’m currently working on equivariant neural networks and graph neural networks, with a mix of theory and practice. I did my undergrad in Math and Computer Science at Cornell University. My contact information can be found here. Events September 2021: Started my PhD at MIT. December 2020: Received an honorable mention for the CRA Outstanding Undergraduate Researcher Award.

item.title: Other
item.description: Teaching Materials Research Lab Notebooks for 2021 SoNIC workshop at Cornell [Repo] AI for Social Networks Presentation at Inspirit AI Summer Scholars 2021 [Slides] Social Media and Data Science class at Rainstorm 2021 [Slides] Cornell Undergrad Notes This is a compilation of notes in \(\LaTeX\) for some of the courses that I have taken at Cornell. These notes are taken in class so they tend not to include drawings and may be messy at points; the blame should fall on me—not the instructors—for any issues in the notes.
Contact I can be reached by email at dereklim(at)mit[dot]edu.
